Description: Mummy of an adult female, wrappings removed. The arms are extended along the front of the body, with the hands resting on the thighs. The skull and both feet are detached, and the chest wall has been removed, exposing the contents of the chest cavity. These include apparent preserved internal organs, together with a large bundle of cloth located inside the lower left abdomen. The body has suffered damage, probably during the unwrapping and subsequent examination.
Curator's comments: M Serpico and R White in C J Eyre (ed.), Proceedings 7th International Congress of Egyptologists (Leuven, 1998), 1044-1046, figs. 2-3.
Bibliographic references: Fletcher, Antoine and Hill 2014 / Regarding the Dead: Human Remains in the British Museum (p.107, p.110, table 1)
Acquisition name: Donated by: St Batholomew's Hospital, London
Acquisition notes: Presented by the Department of Anatomy, St Bartholomew's Hospital, Medical College, London
